summary: Many federal activities—like loan guarantees or flood insurance—are intended to protect people from the effects of adverse events. We found 148 activities like these, which carry a risk of future financial commitments for the federal government. For some activities, such as pension and life insurance, the federal commitment occurs years before payments are reflected in the budget. This analysis supports our 2007 recommendation that Congress...
title: Fiscal Exposures: Federal Insurance and Other Activities That Transfer Risk or Losses to the Government
